travels.title: Croatia '07
travels.headertext: We went to Croatia in April 2007. We flew to Dubrovnik, then rented a car and drove north along the coast to Split and up to Paklenica National Park. After that, we headed to Zagreb via Plitvice Lakes National Park.

entry.text: All the red roofs of Dubrovnik that you hear of...they really are quite amazing.
One of the best things of Dubrovnik is the way you can walk on the walls of the city clear around it and get amazing views of everything. It helped that the weather was absolutely wonderful.
The island of Lokrum is just across the harbor from old town Dubrovnik. It's a nice park to visit on a warm day, and you get great view back to the city.

Paklenica National Park is centered on two gorges that run back into the hills. It's a major destination for rock climbers. We skipped the climbing, but did have a really nice hike back along the river and up to a forest hut.

The other national park we visited, Plitvice Lakes, is a series of lakes pouring down through limestone structures. There are waterfalls between each lake, and each lake is a different color because of its chemistry.
There really are waterfalls everywhere. You walk around on boardwalks or small paths. Its a great place to explore.
The funicular in Zagreb is a well-known landmark.

The main shopping street and square in Zagreb are the center of the city. The metro trains run straight through the square. There's nothing to keep pedestrians from walking in front of the train. I guess your suppose to pay attention.
